Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
torture \tor"ture\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {tortured} (t[^o]r"t[-u]rd; 135); p. pr. & vb. n. {tTorturing.}] [Cf. F. Torturer. ] 1. To put to torture; to pain extremely; to harass; to vex. [1913 Webster]
2. To punish with torture; to put to the rack; as, to torture an accused person. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
3. To wrest from the proper meaning; to distort. --Jar. Taylor. [1913 Webster]
4. To keep on the stretch, as a bow. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
The bow tortureth the string. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]

tortured adj 1: subjected to intense pain; "hundreds of tortured prisoners" 2: experiencing intense pain especially mental pain; "an anguished conscience"; "a small tormented schoolboy"; "a tortured witness to another's humiliation" [syn: {anguished}, {tormented}]
